attributes.action: Take steps towards the closure of Guantanamo Bay
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We ask that the UK request a UN inquiry into human right violations in Guantanamo Bay. The Declaration of human right clearly states that:

Article 10.
Everyone is entitled in full equality to a fair and public hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal, in the determination of his rights and obligations and of any criminal charge against him.

Article 11.
(1) Everyone charged with a penal offence has the right to be presumed innocent until proved guilty according to law in a public trial at which he has had all the guarantees necessary for his defence.

The people detained have not had a public trial and therfore have also had their article 9 rights violated. That right being:

Article 9

No one shall be subjected to arbitrary arrest, detention or exile.

Therefore we call for the UK government to request a Inquiry by the UN and to request the closure of Guantanamo Bay.The UK is an independent country and is not a US colony.We need to stand up for our principles or the UK will simply be viewed as the next US state.
